Comment: Skimming through it.  I wouldn't call this a puff piece.  They basically just let him talk.  He comes off kinda pathetic, actually.  ETA: The Atlantic reporters do call him on some of his shit and in return they receive more of his shit.  Like I said, it's not a puff piece.  I get the feeling they're strategically pulling their punches, not so much so they can retain access (the acquired access by fucking cold calling his personal phone) but just to keep him talking.  I imagine they think there's nothing they can do that would be more informative to the public than what they've already got cooking.
